com.ausregistry.jtoolkit2.session

Class CommandCounter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ausregistry.jtoolkit2.session.CommandCounter

  • public class CommandCounter
extends java.lang.Object
    Keep track of how many commands of each type have been processed recently. Instances of this class provide no synchronization. If multiple threads access an instance concurrently, they must provide their own synchronization. Specifically, concurrent invocations of increment may exhibit unexpected behaviour.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CommandCounter()
      Construct a command counter using the default reset interval.
      CommandCounter(long resetInterval)
      Construct a command counter which ages command processing records out based on the given reset interval (in milliseconds).

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long getCount(CommandType type)
      Get the total number of commands of the given type recorded by this counter.
      int getExactRecentTotal()
      Get the total number of commands processed recently.
      int getRecentCount(CommandType type)
      Get the number of commands of the given type processed recently (within the reset interval from now).
      int getRecentTotal()
      Get an approximation of the total number of commands processed recently.
      long getTotal()
      Get the total number of commands of all types recorded by this counter.
      void increment(CommandType type)
      Increment the count of commands of the given type processed recently.

      • CommandCounter

      • CommandCounter

        public CommandCounter(long resetInterval)
        Construct a command counter which ages command processing records out based on the given reset interval (in milliseconds).
        Parameters:
        resetInterval - the interval of time over which counts are taken.

    • Method Detail

      • increment

        public void increment(CommandType type)
        Increment the count of commands of the given type processed recently.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of command being processed.

      • getRecentCount

        public int getRecentCount(CommandType type)
        Get the number of commands of the given type processed recently (within the reset interval from now).

      • getCount

        public long getCount(CommandType type)
        Get the total number of commands of the given type recorded by this counter.

      • getTotal

        public long getTotal()
        Get the total number of commands of all types recorded by this counter.

      • getRecentTotal

        public int getRecentTotal()
        Get an approximation of the total number of commands processed recently. This is actually an upper bound on the actual number of commands processed recently, as the underlying per-command type lists are not necessarily up-to-date. For the exact number, but at significantly greater cost in execution time, use getExactTotal.

      • getExactRecentTotal

        public int getExactRecentTotal()
        Get the total number of commands processed recently. This first cleans up the underlying per-command type lists to guarantee that only recent commands are counted in the total.
